availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Paducah, Kentucky, farmer and grocery clerk. Mississippi native. Married to Mary E. Vontress Rabb in Union County on December 19, 1850. Father of Mary V. Rabb, Fanny B. Rabb, Nina B. Rabb, Eloise F. Rabb, and Nanny Rabb. Farmer in McCracken County in 1850. Grocery clerk in Paducah in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, McCracken, District 2, p. 168B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, McCracken, Paducah, p. 893.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, McCracken, Paducah, p. 168A.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Union County Marriages, Film # 545986.
